ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Really enjoyed the wide diversity of speakers. Having the ability to go to lunch with speakers in a number of different leadership roles was a privilege!
This course was a favorite during my time at Yale. Unrivaled access to key leaders in the field. Professors extremely open to discussion, outside meetings, etc.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Jennifer Prah Ruger  Really good facilitators of lunchtime discussions and lectures.
Instructor: Jennifer Prah Ruger  Responsive via e-mails, willing to help if she had time/knew the topic you were interested in.
Instructor: Thomas Pogge  Helpful feedback on concept papers.

Instructor: Thomas Pogge  So incredibly impressed with how much time and attention he was willing to provide students despite his schedule. Really appreciate all the paper feedback I got over the course.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A great opportunity to be exposed to and learn from top-notch leaders in health. Fascinating. Wonderful opportunity to have conversations with these individuals, to pick their brains and learn about their experiences. Speakers very candid.
